titleInfo.title: City Market House under construction, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1937

mods.identifier: RG 412 824 Market House under construction Ben West Municipal 001

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: A view of the construction of the City Market Building, a municipal market house and private garage for the automobiles of city officials, circa 1937, built on the north side of the Public Square in downtown Nashville. It was designed by architect Henry C. Hibbs, with the construction contract awarded to Foster and Creighton. This structure is built of brick on a concrete frame, with its pitched roof of copper with a dome extending up from a flat roof around the edge of the building. In later years, the building was enlarged and became the Ben West Municipal Building. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission.
